links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = if n > 9 then a(floor(n / 10)) + 1 else 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 31 2001a(n) = floor(log_10(n)) = A055642(n) - 1. - _L. Edson Jeffery_, Jul 09 2014
mathematica: Table[ Length[ IntegerDigits[n, 10] ] - 1, {n, 105}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 10 2013 *)Table[Floor[Log10[n]], {n, 105}] (* _L. Edson Jeffery_, Jul 09 2014 *)
prog: (Haskell)a004216 n = if n <= 9 then 0 else 1 + a004216 (n `div` 10)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 22 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Sep 19 2000
